definition: to promote/to reinstate (in a position or job)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: I think we should play Brown in the finals.
sentences.chinese: 我认为在决赛中我们应起用布朗。

sentences.english: Our revenue for menswear has tripled since we launched the new site.
sentences.chinese: 自从起用了新网站，我们的男装收入已经翻了三番。

sentences.english: Two substitutes were called in during the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 这场篮球比赛起用了两名替补队员。

sentences.english: The word "origami" came to be used occasionally by the beginning of the 18th century.
sentences.chinese: “折手纸工”这个词在18世纪初开始偶然起用。

sentences.english: Police use battons used batons and tear gas trying to try to restore order.
sentences.chinese: 警方起用了电警棍和催泪瓦斯以试图恢复秩序。

sentences.english: The bank started her as a teller.
See how you function , watch the motives and the results of your actions.
sentences.chinese: 试看六根如何起用，观察自己的动机及活动的后果。

definition: to put in an important position
select the best people for promotion
to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to take up a post/to start in a new job
ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to employ/to recruit (talented personnel)/to gather together (a team)
to stand one's ground against the opinion of the masses (idiom)
